sen.j: 京都赤旗事件（きょうとあかはたじけん）とは、1920年（大正9年）11月30日に発生した社会主義者弾圧事件である。
sen.e: Kyoto Red Flag Incident was a crackdown on socialists occurred on November 30, 1920.

sen.j: 友愛会京都支部の支部長を務めた高山義三（たかやま ぎぞう、のちの京都市長）は、1年間志願兵として軍隊勤務に従事し、1920年に除隊した。
sen.e: Gizo TAKAYAMA (later the Mayor of Kyoto prefecture), who worked as the manager of Kyoto Branch of Yuai-kai, served in the army as a volunteer for one year and left the army in 1920.

sen.j: 11月30日早朝、鍋山貞親ら50名余りの社会主義者は、出迎えのため高山のもとに赴いた。
sen.e: In the early morning on November 30, About 50 socialists including Sadachika NABEYAMA went to meet TAKAYAMA.

sen.j: この時彼らが「祝高山義三君出獄」などと大書した赤旗数本を掲げたため、警官隊と衝突した。
sen.e: Then they held up some red flags on which such messages as 'Congratulations on Mr. Gizo Takayama for his release from prison' were written in large characters, and they fought with police.

sen.j: 同日夕刻、鍋山らは逮捕され、調停しようとした荒畑寒村も連座した。
sen.e: In the evening of the same day, NABEYAMA and others were arrested and Kanson ARAHATA, who tried to mediate, was also involved in the trouble.

sen.j: 鍋山らは公務執行妨害罪、傷害罪、及び治安警察法違反の容疑で起訴され、それぞれ2ヶ月～6ヶ月の禁錮が科せられた。
sen.e: NABEYAMA and others were indicted on suspicion of obstruction of performance of public duty, inflicting bodily injury and violation of the Public Order and Police Law, and were sentenced to two to six months' inprisonment.
